Description: Body sherd of Aeolian Grey Ware pottery open work stand; the base flares out below a ring, which preserves traces of additonal parts on top; interior: reserved; exterior: worn dark grey slip; part of open-work animal's body, probably panther, to right, decorated with punch mark spots and incised dots.
Curator's comments: The sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The results placed the fabric (sample NAUK 64) in NAA group G and the origin was determined to be Aeolis.
Most probably from same stand as 1888,0601.638 and 1965,0930.441, and perhaps 1888,0601.639.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 54, Table 1, g (Nauk 64))
Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p.123 fig.10, No.83)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.163)
